dc:title: Entity Resolution Classification Scheme
dc:description: A hierarchical classification scheme for categorizing person entities in library catalog data
dc:creator: Yale University Library

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, perform, interpret, critique, or otherwise contribute to artistic and cultural expressions in various media and forms

skos:scopeNote.@value: Encompasses all forms of creative expression, whether visual, verbal, musical, or performative

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, interpret, or analyze written works, including fiction, poetry, drama, essays, and literary criticism

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes authors, poets, playwrights, literary critics, essayists, and others involved in the creation and analysis of written artistic works

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, interpret, or analyze visual art forms, including painting, sculpture, drawing, photography, printmaking, and design

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes painters, sculptors, photographers, illustrators, designers, art critics, curators, and others concerned with visual expression

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, perform, interpret, or analyze musical works and expressions across genres and traditions

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes composers, musicians, conductors, singers, musicologists, and others involved in the creation, performance, and study of music

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, perform, direct, or analyze works presented through live or recorded performance, including theater, dance, film, and television

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes actors, directors, dancers, choreographers, filmmakers, and others involved in performing arts traditions and media

skos:definition.@value: Persons who discover, analyze, theorize, or otherwise contribute to the systematic study of natural phenomena and the generation of knowledge through empirical methods

skos:scopeNote.@value: Encompasses all branches of scientific inquiry, from natural to applied sciences, medicine, and technology

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study the physical, chemical, and biological aspects of the natural world through observation, experimentation, and theoretical analysis

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes physicists, chemists, biologists, astronomers, geologists, and others who investigate natural phenomena through systematic methods

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study abstract structures, patterns, and relationships through logical reasoning, formal systems, and quantitative methods

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes mathematicians, statisticians, logicians, and others who develop and apply mathematical methods across domains

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, prevent, diagnose, treat, or otherwise address conditions affecting human health through scientific methods and clinical practice

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes physicians, surgeons, nurses, epidemiologists, pharmacologists, public health experts, and others concerned with health and disease

skos:definition.@value: Persons who apply scientific knowledge to solve practical problems, create technologies, or develop methods for practical applications

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes engineers, technologists, inventors, and others who transform scientific principles into practical applications

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, develop, or practice methods of cultivating plants, raising animals, or managing natural resources for human use or environmental sustainability

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes agriculturalists, horticulturists, foresters, ecologists, and others concerned with the cultivation of living organisms and environmental management

skos:definition.@value: Persons who examine, interpret, or analyze human experience, culture, history, language, or thought through critical, theoretical, or philosophical approaches

skos:scopeNote.@value: Encompasses fields concerned with interpretation and meaning, often with emphasis on qualitative and hermeneutic methods

skos:definition.@value: Persons who examine fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, values, reason, mind, and language through conceptual analysis and logical argumentation

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes philosophers, ethicists, logicians, and others who engage in abstract conceptual inquiry and analysis of fundamental questions

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, interpret, lead, or otherwise engage with religious traditions, theological concepts, spiritual practices, or sacred texts

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes theologians, religious leaders, scholars of religion, and others concerned with religious thought, practice, and institutions

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, document, analyze, or interpret past events, societies, cultures, or developments through critical examination of sources and contexts

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes historians, archaeologists, archivists, and others who investigate, reconstruct, and interpret the past

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, analyze, document, or describe language structure, function, use, development, or variation through systematic methods

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes linguists, philologists, lexicographers, and others concerned with the systematic study of language and its properties

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, document, analyze, or interpret cultural practices, social groups, or geographic regions through interdisciplinary approaches

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes anthropologists, ethnographers, folklorists, area specialists, and others who examine cultural phenomena in their social and historical contexts

skos:definition.@value: Persons who lead, govern, analyze, reform, or otherwise engage with social institutions, political systems, economic structures, or collective action

skos:scopeNote.@value: Encompasses fields concerned with social organization, governance, economic activity, and collective behavior

skos:definition.@value: Persons who govern, lead, analyze, or participate in political systems, government institutions, public policy, or international relations

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes politicians, statesmen, diplomats, political scientists, and others involved in governance and political processes

skos:definition.@value: Persons who create, interpret, apply, analyze, or otherwise engage with legal systems, principles, codes, or cases

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes judges, lawyers, legal scholars, and others concerned with legal institutions, principles, and processes

skos:definition.@value: Persons who study, analyze, lead, or participate in economic systems, business enterprises, commercial activities, or financial institutions

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes economists, entrepreneurs, business leaders, and others involved in economic theory, commerce, and business activities

skos:definition.@value: Persons who teach, lead, study, reform, or otherwise contribute to educational institutions, pedagogical methods, or learning processes

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes educators, teachers, professors, educational theorists, and others concerned with teaching, learning, and educational institutions

skos:definition.@value: Persons who lead, serve in, study, or develop military forces, defense systems, martial strategies, or security operations

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes military leaders, strategists, and others involved in defense, security, and military affairs

skos:definition.@value: Persons who advocate for, organize, lead, or study social change, reform movements, humanitarian causes, or civic improvements

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes reformers, activists, philanthropists, and others who work to advance social causes and transform societal conditions

skos:definition.@value: Persons who gather, report, publish, disseminate, or analyze information through various media channels or information technologies

skos:scopeNote.@value: Includes journalists, publishers, editors, and others involved in the creation and dissemination of information through media
